data.title: Implement download button for the MarkDown preview HTML
data.body:
The MarkDown preview functionality is extremely handy and I'd like to suggest and improvement where the preview contains a button for downloading the generated preview HTML as a standalone file that can be shared with team members who don't know how to open MarkDown files.

The obvious question is how to handle images, the options range from just leaving the paths alone and make it a responsibility of the user to make sure they are zipped together with the file, they could also be inlined as BASE64 URIs or instead of saving HTML preview, PDF print preview could be saved with the images embedded within.

For the start I think the first option where the user is required to keep their relative paths in check and zip the images with the downloaded file themselves works best.

data.title: Editor: scroll jumps randomly (after Find?)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Fedora 24

Steps to Reproduce:
here is the tough part. This issue only appeared ~6 weeks ago, but I can't manage to reproduce.
When simply editing multiple files (js, html), switch between them using Ctrl+P
Use Find to get to some text. Them mouse wheel to scroll.
Issue: scroll jumps to bottom of the file first time (it will be fine on further operations on that file, until switching again to another one).

It happens ~20% of the cases. I can't find exact steps to reproduce, but it's annoying enough to finally open an issue. Hope others encounter it too.
Will get back with more info when I can reliably reproduce.

Thanks

data.body:

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.3.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I had opened a .ps1 file through File Explorer in my editor
2. Clicked File -> Save as -> simply selecting another [already existing] folder 
3. Get the error message "The PowerShell session has terminated due to an error, would you like to restart it?"
4. Restarted the PowerShell session, but got the exact same thing when doing Save as on another file.

data.title: Support for logical file structures
data.body:
This has already been partially added with the support of custom views. This is somewhat related to #6328 and should be possible for the default view through a project settings file like ``tsconfig.json``.

A simple use case is a program like GameMaker: Studio (GMS) which uses a logical file structure to hide project meta-data and implementation details.

It would not be possible to offer the same solution as for editing Unity3D projects because GMS's manifest also contains the directory structure.
https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/other/unity

GMS's GMX project format has a main project manifest which lists all the resources of a project such as ``<sprite>sprites\spr_wall1_hor</sprite>``. Visual Studio, Eclipse, and several other programs also have similar project manifests. In order to better support these kinds of project files it should be possible to modify the default explorer view to handle logical file structures, besides just excluding files.

data.title: Unexpected suggestion scoring
data.body: I typed `this._lines` and then pressed `.` and unexpectedly got `_lineStarts` inserted.

data.title: Support for custom toolbars
data.body:
This is a feature that is provided in Atom through an extension.
https://atom.io/packages/tool-bar

As far as I understand, it is not possible in vscode currently any more than a custom debug toolbar is supported. This can be useful for things other than debugging, such as a toolbar to add resource types, as in GameMaker's IDE.

![GameMaker](http://gamemaker.info/library/manual/images/form_main.jpg)

data.title: [feature request] typescript goto-def/peek-def using autocompletion
data.body:
I'm really grateful with VSCode's excellent goto-defs and peek-defs, but I wish it just had one more feature:
**goto-def / peek-def through autocompletion.**
(similar to Go To File... dialog )

current goto-def / peek-def requires that to look at variable V in file B, I would have to open file A that has a reference to variable B.
But often, I'm working on a file C that does not have a direct reference to variable V (and anything on file B), and clicking through the navigator is a huge context-change to me.

Of course, this feature can be partially done using "find all ~ inside this project", but that does not provide any auto-completion support, so I would have to remember the name properly.

This feature could require indexing every variables / interfaces / etc. for every file, so there might be some performance penalty to implement this. (but vscode can provide opt-in/out in settings)

data.title: [FR] Add AUTHORS file to honour contributors
data.body: There are some open-source projects which really likes contributions such as this project, but these various other projects have a `AUTHORS` file in the root directory. I think it might be a good idea to create such a file and update it after merging a contribution or at the very end of a month(i.e. before code freeze).

data.title: Allow extensions to get the current file indentation type
data.body:
I know there are settings for this kind of stuff (like insertSpaces, tabSize, etc.) but there are a ridiculous amount of different ways for those settings to be modified.

It would be very helpful for extensions to be able to determine the current indentation type of the current file.

For example, extensions would be able to stop writing this kind of code:

https://github.com/HookyQR/VSCodeBeautify/blob/509ec7f485074720390f10fce3d19fe1550ba5f5/options.js#L9
.

Actually, I figured it out. For anybody looking at this in the future, you want to look at
`vscode.window.activeTextEditor.options`

data.title: Feature request: Map ts files automatically in Visual Studio Code
data.body:
Actually I am using Version 1.13.1.
When running a typescript project, call stack links are printed out as link to a location in the transpiled js file.
```
at Object.<anonymous> (/work/app/dist/main.js:46:7)
```
It would be useful that user can configure, if such links are translated automatically to their typescript source file location, using the mapping file available in the project.
See also [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44126583](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44126583).

data.title: Pasting and opening a file path into the bar in Open File opens the file but doesn't close the dialog

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a text file somewhere and copy it's whole file path including the file name and extension
2. Bring up the Open File dialog (Ctrl-O)
3. Double click on the address bar that shows the current directory and replace the text with the file path
4. Press Enter

Expected:
- Dialog box closes and the file is opened

Actual
- Dialog box remains open and the file is opened

data.title: Pressing esc with editor focused will hide terminal find widget
data.body:
#15198

Currently we register the command against `KEYBINDING_CONTEXT_TERMINAL_FIND_WIDGET_VISIBLE` so it will hijack esc even when the terminal is not focused.

`ContextKeyExpr.and(KEYBINDING_CONTEXT_TERMINAL_FOCUS, KEYBINDING_CONTEXT_TERMINAL_FIND_WIDGET_VISIBLE)` almost fixes the problem but `KEYBINDING_CONTEXT_TERMINAL_FOCUS` is false when the find widget is focused.

data.title: ${env.APPDATA} in launch.json broke in 1.13?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Win 10

I use launch.json for launching an Electron app, and had it pointed to the electron executable:
"runtimeExecutable": "${env.APPDATA}/nvm/v7.8.0/node_modules/electron/dist/electron.exe",

This seems to have stopped working in 1.13. Did using environment variables in the launch config change, is something else recommended?

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use ${env.APPDATA} in runtimeExecutable of launch.json 
2. The system cannot find the specified file

data.title: Improve find in terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Basic find in terminal functionality was added in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15198. Here are some of the improvements we can make

- Highlight all instances of term in current viewport
- Use a different selection type so that regular selection isn't hijacked, plus a color with a higher contrast can be used.
- Find multiple instances on the same line
- Find terms that are wrapped across 2 lines
- Options: regex, case sensitivity, match word
- Add "No results" label, need to think about what to show in the gap when there are results. We probably shouldn't be searching the entire buffer when we don't have to for performance reasons.
- Add animation to terminal find widget just like it does on editor

Upstream improve find API issue: https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/issues/705

/cc @rebornix
